choices.name: Get started with research for your Massachusetts ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Massachusetts ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Massachusetts research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Massachusetts research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Massachusetts Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AR—Finding Your Massachusetts Ancestors

  2. Learn more about Massachusetts research.

    ☆ AAC—Researching in the Bay State—Video series (account required)

  3. Read this guide to Massachusetts research from American Ancestors.

    ☆ AA—Massachusetts Guide

  4. Ancestry: Explore resources for Massachusetts research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Massachusetts Resources
    ☆ AC—Massachusetts State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  5. Record Finder: Use the Massachusetts Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Massachusetts Record Selection Table

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial Massachusetts.

      ☆ AC—Colonial Massachusetts
      ☆ AAC—Mayflower and Colonial Research—3:37


    Case Studies
    1. Follow this research study for Massachusetts ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

      ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Massachusetts Research, 1880-Present

    2. Follow these case studies for Massachusetts research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding the family of a Massachusetts Revolutionary War soldier
      ☆ LDS—Finding the birth place and family of a Swedish immigrant living in Massachusetts


    Ethnic
    1. Learn about Massachusetts ethnic research in this video.

      ☆ AAC—Ethnic Research—3:40
    2. African American: Learn about African Americans in Massachusetts in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Massachusetts

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for Massachusetts.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Massachusetts in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Massachusetts


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    ☆ AC—Colonial Massachusetts

choices.name: Learn about Massachusetts archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Massachusetts archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Massachusetts Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Massachusetts State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Learn about Massachusetts record repositories in this video.

    ☆ AAC—Archives and Repositories—3:42

  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Massachusetts.
  4. Explore Massachusetts State Archives collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Massachusetts genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Massachusetts research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Massachusetts ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city and county records. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Massachusetts County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Massachusetts.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Massachusetts Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Massachusetts Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Massachusetts Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Massachusetts.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Massachusetts research.
  2. Explore the Massachusetts research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Massachusetts research.
  4. Explore Massachusetts research questions in the ☆Genealogy Stack Exchange.

choices.name: Learn about Massachusetts genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Massachusetts in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Massachusetts Societies

  2. Explore the New England Historic Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Massachusetts Historical Society site.
  4. Visit the Massachusetts Society of Genealogists page on Facebook.
  5. Explore Massachusetts genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Massachusetts.

Regional/Local Societies
